intro: Osmia myriocephala, commonly known as the broad-headed mason bee, is a solitary bee species belonging to the family Megachilidae. It is native to various regions of Europe and parts of Asia, where it plays a significant role in pollination. The female bee constructs its nest in hollow stems or pre-existing cavities, using a mixture of plant resins and mud to form the cell walls. Its distinctive broad head and metallic blue body make it easily recognizable. Osmia myriocephala is an important pollinator for a variety of flowering plants, contributing to both agricultural and ecological systems.
